meanings.definition: A tropical plant of the arum family, grown in the West Indies for its edible tubers.
meanings.sent1: The malanga plant has large leaves and produces tubers underground.
meanings.sent2: People in the West Indies enjoy cooking and eating malanga tubers.
meanings.sent3: When the malanga plant heard it was delicious, it blushed bright green.
meanings.sent4: The malanga tubers were hidden treasures waiting to be unearthed.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly cooked malanga filled the kitchen with warmth and comfort.

meanings.definition: The starchy tuber of this plant, used as a food crop.
meanings.sent1: I bought some malanga from the market to make a delicious stew.
meanings.sent2: The malanga tuber is a versatile ingredient in many traditional dishes.
meanings.sent3: The malanga tuber rolled off the table and tried to escape the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a warm malanga soup on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The malanga tuber's texture was smooth and satisfying when cooked just right.
